```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(collapse = TRUE, comment = "#>")
library(biomarkerPanels)
```

## Overview

This vignette illustrates a minimal workflow for constructing compact biomarker
panels while targeting sensitivity and specificity trade-offs.

## Simulated Example

```{r simulate}
example_data <- simulate_expression_data(p = 200, n = 40, k = 2, seed = 42)
str(example_data$x_list[[1]][seq_len(3), 1:5])
```

## Next Steps

The optimization functionality is under active development. Placeholder calls
below illustrate the intended API.

```{r placeholder, eval=FALSE}
objectives <- define_objectives()
result <- optimize_panel(example_data$x_list[[1]], example_data$y_list[[1]],
                         objectives = objectives, max_features = 5)
plot_pareto_front(result@objectives)
```
